actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Roll Call 242
actions-list.actionItem: Yea and Nay vote pending.

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 682 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3838) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2026 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3486) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter and reenter the United States after being removed, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 682 and agreeing to the resolution, if ordered.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to Ethiopia declared in Executive Order 14046 of September 17, 2021, is to continue in effect beyond September 17, 2025
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-94).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to persons who commit, threaten to commit, or support terrorism declared in Executive Order 13224 of September 23, 2001, as amended, is to continue in effect beyond September 23, 2025
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-93).

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 682, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded the yeas and nays and Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 682.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 682 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3838) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2026 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3486) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter and reenter the United States after being removed, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House resumed with Morning-Hour Debate.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 452 amended.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Don Bacon to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
